Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: These five fragments of papyrus, which have been found at Oxyrhynchus (P. Oxy. III 449) and which date from the second half of the second century of our time, carry, on the recto, the start of the tragedy "Andromache" of Euripides. The roll of papyrus probably contained 28 columns of text on a total length of no less than three and a half meters. The verso was probably used to contain a copy of a literary work.
